intro: Maytenus spinosa, commonly known as the spiny mayten, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its thorny stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red berries that are attractive to birds. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Maytenus spinosa thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in dry forests and scrublands.
